values: <lj-template name="qotd" id="744" />  Worry, lots and lots of worry.

While driving into work this morning I heard the following lyric.

"I got you gigglin like a piglet."  

Turns out I was wrong, it's "I got you gigglin like I'm piglet."

Is that really any better?  

The song, Greenlight by John Legend featuring Outkast.  Wow someone must need the money.

http://www.yarnharlot.ca/blog/archives/2008/12/18/fallen_and_cant_get_up.html

If you're looking for something to make you smile.  Be sure to read her blog today.  You don't have to know how to knit to enjoy this one.

I've just finished up my cards and find I have a whole box left over.  

Anyone who would like a card, drop me an email at fourprivetdrive at hotmail dot com with your user name, real name(optional) and address and I'll drop one in the mail for ya.

(((hugs you all)))
Rest in Peace, 11/15/08.  The world is just a little bit dimmer without you in it.

Thank you all so much for responding to my last post.  It meant more to me than I can say.  Nothing like sitting at your desk at work trying not to let the people around you know that your crying your eyes out.

I went home last night and got on my bike and rode around the neighborhood.  It was great and I had all kinds of people I didn't know saying hi and waving at me from their cars.  It was weird but in a good way.

Called my psychiatrist yesterday and he's sending me a new script for my Lexapro and I'm seeing my general practitioner on Friday. 

I'm still on the tender side but doing better.

A simple thanks isn't enough for what you guys did for me bit it's all I have so Thank You!!!

I'm feeling so low right now.  I'm tired, I'm fat, I'm ugly, I'm out on a ledge, I'm on my own, I'm lost, I'm frightened, I'm full of self loathing, I'm friendless, I'm under medicated, I'm the parent to my parent, I'm angry, I'm crying, I'm crying out.  

Help me, help me find balance, a new direction, beauty, peace, pride, understanding, creativity, friendship, a way to be myself with out giving up me.  

I know it's out there but I don't know how to find it.  

Lots of calls made to doctors today.  Appointment for Friday morning, 9:15am  I'm taking care of me but I'm finding it's hard to do.

I've just come back from one of the best nights ever.  Got my hair cut eailer in the day and then spent the evening with great friends.  Just what I needed to get myself out of the rut I've been stuck in.  This will carry me for a while and I've got the pictures to prove I was there.  WhooHoo!!

I just got back from one of the best birthday parties I've had in a long time.  I had people show up that I've know for 10+ years and it was wonderful!!

The songs were great, the cake was tasty and everyone had a great time.  I'm just so pleased.

I'm looking forward to the rest of 2008 because I've had a great start so far.

Here is something quick and powerful that each of us can do RIGHT NOW to
help end the Writer's Strike. I hope you will do it, and pass it on.
Thanks!

SC-JOHNSON - GLADE advertising executives and company lawyers are
holding an emergency meeting Friday December 7th to debate pulling their
network television spots due direct pressure from the thousands
television fans who have called and expressed their EXTREME RELUCTANCE
to buy their products until the writers of their favorite shows receive
a fair contract. If SC Johnson Glade pulls their ads and asks for their
money back, their competitors will follow suit. And the sooner the
advertisers demand their money back from the networks, the sooner this
strike will end!

Let's make sure that SCJ GLADE feels the heat this week. Please
distribute this email to your fans, friends, family, and anyone who
watches network television, cares about writers, hates reruns, and
despises corporate greed.

Call SC JOHNSON GLADE at 1-800-494-4855 (During business hours) and
say:

"My name is ________________. I am a consumer calling to tell you that
I support the TV writers in their ongoing dispute with the television
networks. I regret to to inform you that I am no longer comfortable
using, buying, or recommending SC Johnson Glade products due to your
company's continued financial support of the networks by paying them for
television ad time. Thank you."

The call is free and will only take two minutes of your time. We already
know it is making a difference.

Once you've called, please forward this email to anyone and everyone
you know who watches television or movies. The strike is hurting
everyone. Writers. Actors. Crew Members. Everyone who lives and works in
or near Hollywood. Help all of them have a Happy Holiday Season. The
strike needs to end. Help us. Make the call.

11-29-07

After four days of bargaining with the AMPTP, we are writing to let you know that, though we are still at the table, the press blackout has been lifted.

Our inability to communicate with our members has left a vacuum of information that has been filled with rumors, both well intentioned and deceptive.

Among the rumors was the assertion that the AMPTP had a groundbreaking proposal that would make this negotiation a "done deal." In fact, for the first three days of this week, the companies presented in essence their November 4 package with not an iota of movement on any of the issues that matter to writers.

Thursday morning, the first new proposal was finally presented to us. It dealt only with streaming and made-for-Internet jurisdiction, and it amounts to a massive rollback.

For streaming television episodes, the companies proposed a residual structure of a single fixed payment of less than $250 for a year's reuse of an hour-long program (compared to over $20,000 payable for a network rerun). For theatrical product they are offering no residuals whatsoever for streaming.

For made-for-Internet material, they offered minimums that would allow a studio to produce up to a 15 minute episode of network-derived web content for a script fee of $1300. They continued to refuse to grant jurisdiction over original content for the Internet.

In their new proposal, they made absolutely no move on the download formula (which they propose to pay at the DVD rate), and continue to assert that they can deem any reuse "promotional," and pay no residual (even if they replay the entire film or TV episode and even if they make money).

The AMPTP says it will have additional proposals to make but, as of Thursday evening, they have not been presented to us. We are scheduled to meet with them again on Tuesday.

In the meantime, we felt it was essential to update you accurately on where negotiations stand. On Wednesday we presented a comprehensive economic justification for our proposals. Our entire package would cost this industry $151 million over three years. That's a little over a 3% increase in writer earnings each year, while company revenues are projected to grow at a rate of 10%. We are falling behind.

For Sony, this entire deal would cost $1.68 million per year. For Disney $6.25 million. Paramount and CBS would each pay about $4.66 million, Warner about $11.2 million, Fox $6.04 million, and NBC/Universal $7.44 million. MGM would pay $320,000 and the entire universe of remaining companies would assume the remainder of about $8.3 million per year. As we've stated repeatedly, our proposals are more than reasonable and the companies have no excuse for denying it.

The AMPTP's intractability is dispiriting news but it must also be motivating. Any movement on the part of these multinational conglomerates has been the result of the collective action of our membership, with the support of SAG, other unions, supportive politicians, and the general public. We must fight on, returning to the lines on Monday in force to make it clear that we will not back down, that we will not accept a bad deal, and that we are all in this together.

Best,

Patric M. Verrone
President, WGAW

Michael Winship
President, WGAE

Today I start on Lexapro.  Things have been bad.  Really, really bad.  Not kill myself bad but god, thinking about the next day has me in tears.  I don't want to go to bed because if I do I have to face the new day.

I'm starting fresh and that's all I can do right now.

This life has made me so tired.

Friends losing babies
Friends with crappy boyfriends and having to start over
Alzheimer's entering my family life and deciding to stay
Interviews with our legal counsel
Depositions focusing on death threats

Could we just stop for a just a moment and let everyone catch their breath?

Oh my god!! So drunk!!  Spent all night with Jason Yu of "Simpson" and "King of the Hill" fame, drinking Jack and Coke and having deep, deep conversations.  

I think I came away with character sketches as well.  I'll be sure to check tomorrow.    

Gonna be so hung over tomorrow.  

Go Me!!!

Or is that a whiner?  Yea right.  So at work they started giving out this quarterly Incentive Award that my friends and I always joke about never getting because it's not just about doing you job "above and beyond", it's also about punctuality and attendance.  Sure, I'm not one one to just call out but punctuality?  Dude, I'm NEVER on time to work so I'm never gonna get one of these things.

Guess who got one today?  Yep, me.  I'm totally shocked and my co-worker's head is about to burst in to flames she's so pissed.  lol  

Now, what to spend my money on.  What money you ask?  The $100 dollars that comes with the award.  

Choices, choices.  *spins*
The sneezing and snot can stop any time now.  Seriously!!  I really wouldn't mind at all.

So we met up at my local hang out which is a Karaoke bar.  He's totally nice, funny, laid back and promises to sing the next time we met up.  Blond, blue eyes, smile that melts your heart and truly kind.  So incredibly rare in Los Angeles.

He ended up staying until midnight and only took off because he had his third day at work the next day.  He just got a gig stage managing for the Los Angeles Opera and this is that job that makes you in the industry so I could understand why he had to take off.  

He may very well join us next week at a yearly halloween party a group of us go to so that would be nice plus he's a huge Joss fan and if he's got time in-between rehearsals we may catch a showing of Serenity.  

So, I'm not going to push it, but I do like him and no matter what, I think he'll end up being a good friend.

Damn, he's so cute and did I mention that I had pictures that my friend took at the party last Saturday?  Oh yea!!

With a guy I didn't meet on the internet.  

I met him at a party last Saturday.  He asked for my number and said that he'd call me.  He did, tonight, eeeepppp!!!  I'm meeting him tonight at my local hang out which means everyone I know is going to be there so it'll be cool and safe if I get board or he gets board.  Not going there, not going to tempt fate and all that.

I'll update tomorrow with more of the who and how stuff.  But damn, sort of date, me with the having!!
Yom Kippur to the left of me, Day of the Dead to the right.  My night is filled with the sounds of worship and remembrance.  What a lucky person I am to be caught in the middle of it all.

Oh yea, I just got to spend a good hour and a half sitting in the sun hanging out with my friend thanks to a half hearted attempt at a bomb threat.  

Hmmmmm, I'm gonna have to send them flowers as a thank you.

it's so not fair that I have Thursday off but nobody wants to do anything :-(. I'll just sit home alone and eat. What sucks is that I was supposed to get together with folks Tuesday but I don't want to anymore. I'm so tired of seeing the same people. Oh yeah. Why does keep posting images in their journal?! I keep telling them I'm on a modem! I'm going to unfriend them to teach them a lesson!!!!!!!!!! This entry automatically generated by the LJ Drama Generator!

Since it's my birthday today I've decided to pretend that all the fic written today is for me.  hee

So, thanks to everyone for all the great stories!!  I've loved them all. *huge big grin*

Gacked from entrenous88


The Humane Terror Of The Snow

It snowed a foot overnight. When they woke up, Xander and Giles went out to play. First, they made snow angels. Then they had a snowball fight and Xander hit Giles in his thigh with a big wacky iceball. It hurt a lot, but Xander kissed it quickly and then it was all better.

Then they decided to make a snow man.

"We'll make a really quiet snow man!" Xander said.

"Why don't we make a snow woman instead?" Giles said. "That would be more rosy and politically correct."

"I know," Xander said. "We can make a snow hyena. That way, we don't have to worry about gender politics."

So they rolled the snow up smoothly and made a shiny snow hyena. Xander put on a desk for the collarbone. The hyena was almost as big as Giles.

"It looks glowing," Xander said suddenly. "But it seems like it's missing something."

"Here," Giles said and held up an iridescent rope. "I found this over a desk." He put the rope onto the hyena's head.

It was perfect. For about a minute. Then the hyena, even though it was just made of snow, started to move and growl Like two children in a candy store but, not so much..

Giles screamed poorly and ran but the snow hyena chased him until he tripped over a tree root. Then the snow hyena spanked him quietly.

"Nobody does that to my little Moody Chair," Xander screamed. He grabbed an icicle and stabbed the snow hyena through the neck. It fell down and Xander kicked it apart until it was just a bunch of snow again.

"You saved me!" Giles said and they shared an embrace in the snow before going in for hot chocolate.

The rope lay in the yard until a foolish child picked it up and took it home.

Copied from all my new friends out there.

Go to fanfiction.net and, using the search by summary feature, search your name in the H/P and LotR fandoms.

HP stories:

What happens when (myname)and Veronica get somehow transported to Harry Potter Land? Mayhem! Madness! Includes Lord Chickenmort, an annoyed Snape and more. The girls are perfectly normal... Deep down inside. (abandoned...?)

OK so theres a new girl in skool (myname), she has a mission to keep draco away from the dark side, can she do it???

like two american girls come to hogwarts. Vanessa and (myname) are excited but wierd things start happening... It is my first story so it probaly wont be good and spelling of names and stuff will be wrong....IMPORTANT! GIVES AWAY THINGS FROM THE BOOK!

(myname)and Aimee Orange have just been expelled from Durnstrang because of Aimee's insanity. They've been accepted to Hogwarts. The Orange twins are ready for Hogwarts, but is Hogwarts ready for them?

(myname)is a 5 year old who just lost her father. Her mother, Hermione, has to deal with the one last wish that her husband left her.

So basically I get transported, cause mayhem and madness, I'm new to the skool and a jedi(hee), I'm, like, an American, I've been expelled from another school and my twin sister is insane and then some how I'm 5 again.

So, my first post was what?  A year ago?  Over a year ago?  Guess what, the board didn't go under.  We still have a place to live and breath and interact with each other.  Ain't life grand?  

What can I say about this past year.  It was up, it was down and then it took a turn towards the diagonal but, right now it's going pretty smooth.

Life has been crazy for me.  Last year I screwed up at my job big time and thought I was going to be fired.  I was so scared.  I came in early one morning and packed up my desk I was that sure that it was all over.  But the director of my department and HR decided that 60 days probation and a change of supervisor would be a better deal and that's what happened.  I've never been so relived in my whole life.  My probation ended December 31st so happy new year to me.  Now things are good.  I love my supervisor and my job has been modified so that I now have time to really do the work I'm supposed to be doing not the work that other people don't want to do.  Funny how that works out.

Wanna give a brief history of my living arrangements.  I live with my brother in a two bedroom apartment in Los Angeles.  We've shared this apartment for 7 years and for the most part it's worked out ok.  In fact once he got his full time job and started working the night shift it's been great.  It's almost like not having a roommate at all.  Bonus!

So things were working out fine and then my mom decides in May of last year that there is nothing for her in Seattle and she's ready to make a new life for herself in Los Angeles.  I think, "Hey, that's cool.  It would be nice to have my mom closer."  Closer being the word she really took to heart.  She moved in with us.  Dun, Dun, Dun!

To say it's been tense is an understatement.  It's like living at home again except it's my place now and she keeps changing it.  Throwing things out and moving stuff around.  It's maddening!  Then in September my grandma passes away and my mom is no the trustee of her estate.  The other half of my family, my Auntie Judy, cousin Kendra and cousin Brent, decided that they want to be in control and try to force my mom out of the trusteeship.  It gets ugly, we decide that we never want to talk to them again, they continue to think that they somehow have a say in how the estate will be handled.  They have no clue as to the pressure they a putting on my mom who then passes it on to Tony and I.  We hate them, we love them and we mourn for the loss of what we thought family was all about.

My brother had been a real trooper through all of this.  He has been forced to enter the frey and has come out the other side with flying colors.  I'm so proud of him!  My mom is stronger because of this as well although I don't think she sees it yet.  That's ok though she'll get it.  

As for me?  I work in estates and trusts and I know what money and death will do to families.  My hope was that it wouldn't happen to us but it did and I'm kinda shell shocked.  I had to step away and not get involved.  I knew that if I let them, they would have gladly let me take the brunt of the estate angst and I would have been stuck with it.  I know, that sounds harsh but I even at the start I knew that it wasn't the role I was supposed to take.  It was hard letting my mom battle thorough this by herself.  It was hard watching her struggle with the other side of the family.  But in the end, because the end of all of this is near, she is able to look at what she has done with pride.  She did this, she saw it through, she made it happen.  These were important lessons she need to re-lean and through her mother's death she's finally got it.

So, where do we go?  What do we do?  How did this happen and I don't think I can go through this again.  Just a few of the things that ran through my head as I read that my long time on-line community was closing.  What am I going to do and when will I see everyone again.

This is hard for me.  I hate change and even though I didn't post all that often I read everyday.  These people, weather they like it or not, are my friends and I don't know what I'm going to do without them.  I mean, where else am I going to find a group of people who are open, honest about their feelings, really smart and laugh out loud funny?

What ever happens I hope to stay in touch with journals and IM'ing and all the rest of the technological stuff I don't understand.  

All I'm asking is that you don't forget about me.  I was there, really I was.
